intro: Meniscium deltigerum, commonly known as the broad-leaved meniscium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Meniscium deltigerum is often found in calcareous soils and is a valuable component of moist woodland ecosystems.
